intro: Pygeum scortechinii, commonly known as the African wild almond, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by three-lobed, woody fruits containing three seeds each. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystem, though it is not widely cultivated outside of its natural range.
